original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 3:1-3 (NLT)

1 O Lord, I have so many enemies; so many are against me.

2 So many are saying, "God will never rescue him!" 
3 But You, O Lord, are a shield around me; You are my glory, the one who
holds my head high. 



Today's Thoughts:

David was not sitting on his throne in a place of power, but he was running
for his life

from his rebellious son, Absalom, and a group of traitors. .



When circumstances go against us, it is tempting to think that God is also
against us.

But David reminds us that the opposite is true. When everything seems to go
against 

us, God is still for us. .



So if circumstance has turned against you-don't blame God-seek Him. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, as this life sends many trials my way, I pray that

Your Holy Spirit would make me mindful that You are but a prayer away.

Guide, direct, and be my shield. Amen.



Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: David was not sitting on his throne in a place of power, but he was running for his life from his rebellious son, Absalom, and a group of traitors. When circumstances go against us, it is tempting to think that God is also against us. But David reminds us that the opposite is true. When everything seems to go against us, God is still for us. So if circumstance has turned against you-don't blame God-seek Him. .
original_verse_text: 1 O Lord, I have so many enemies; so many are against me. 2 So many are saying, "God will never rescue him!" 3 But You, O Lord, are a shield around me; You are my glory, the one who holds my head high.
prayer: Heavenly Father, in times of distress and turmoil, we find refuge in Your unwavering presence. When the waves of adversity threaten to overwhelm us, we cling to the truth that You are our ever-present help. Lord, even when circumstances seem to turn against us, we know that You are for us, steadfast in Your love and protection. Grant us the wisdom to seek You, to trust in Your sovereign plan, and to find our strength in Your abiding peace. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: David was not sitting on his throne in a place of power, but he was running for his life from his rebellious son, Absalom, and a group of traitors. When circumstances go against us, it is tempting to think that God is also against us. But David reminds us that the opposite is true. When everything seems to go against us, God is still for us. So if circumstances have turned against you, don't blame God—seek Him.
subject: Circumstances May Oppose, but God Remains
verse_text: 1 O Lord, I have so many enemies; so many are against me. 2 So many are saying, “God will never rescue him!” 3 But You, O Lord, are a shield around me; You are my glory, the one who holds my head high.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 3:5 (NLT)

5 I lay down and slept, yet I woke up in safety, for the Lord was watching
over me. 



Today's Thoughts:

Sleep does not come easily during a crises. David could have had many
sleepless nights when his son 

Absalom rebelled and gathered together an army to kill David. But he slept
peacefully, even during

the rebellion. .



What made the difference? ? ? David cried out to the Lord-and the Lord
heard him.

The assurance of answered prayer bring peace. It is easier to sleep well
when we have

full assurance that God is in control of circumstances. .



If you are lying awake at night worrying about circumstances you can't
change-pour out

your heart to God, and thank Him that He is in control-Then sleep will come.
. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, You know that I have often worried needlessly when You are very
capable

of taking care of any circumstance that comes my way. Forgive me for my
little faith. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: Sleep does not come easily during a crises. David could have had many sleepless nights when his son Absalom rebelled and gathered together an army to kill David. But he slept peacefully, even during the rebellion. What made the difference? ? ? David cried out to the Lord-and the Lord heard him. The assurance of answered prayer bring peace. It is easier to sleep well when we have full assurance that God is in control of circumstances. If you are lying awake at night worrying about circumstances you can't change-pour out your heart to God, and thank Him that He is in control-Then sleep will come.
original_verse_text: 5 I lay down and slept, yet I woke up in safety, for the Lord was watching over me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in the midst of our trials and tribulations, seeking Your peace and comfort. Like David, we find rest in the assurance that You hear our cries and are in control of all circumstances. We thank You for the promise of Your presence, even in the darkest of nights. May our hearts be filled with the confidence that You will guide and protect us, that we may sleep securely in Your care. Amen.
reflection: Sleep does not come easily during a crises. David could have had many sleepless nights when his son Absalom rebelled and gathered together an army to kill David. But he slept peacefully, even during the rebellion. What made the difference? ? ? David cried out to the Lord-and the Lord heard him. The assurance of answered prayer bring peace. It is easier to sleep well when we have full assurance that God is in control of circumstances. If you are lying awake at night worrying about circumstances you can't change-pour out your heart to God, and thank Him that He is in control-Then sleep will come.
subject: Peaceful Sleep in Crisis
verse_text: 5 I lay down and slept, yet I woke up in safety, for the Lord was watching over me.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Ps. 3:8

Victory comes from You, O Lord. May Your blessings rest on Your People.



Today's Thoughts:

The "Great Commission" is that believers are to be witnesses telling the

world who God is and what He has done. .



Do people know who God is through your words and example?



They cannot see God directly-but they can see Him reflected in you!



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, when I fail to be a living example for You, I pray that Your

Spirit would awaken me to my negligence. .Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10
original_reflection_text: The "Great Commission" is that believers are to be witnesses telling the world who God is and what He has done. Do people know who God is through your words and example? They cannot see God directly-but they can see Him reflected in you!
original_verse_text: Victory comes from You, O Lord. May Your blessings rest on Your People.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that You have called us to be the light of the world, reflecting Your glory and proclaiming Your truth. Help us to live in a way that draws others to You, that they may see Your goodness and be drawn to the salvation found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our lives be a testament to Your power and love, that all may know that salvation belongs to You. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: The “Great Commission” is that believers are to be witnesses telling the world who God is and what He has done. Do people know who God is through your words and example? They cannot see God directly, but they can see Him reflected in you!
subject: Reflect God's Glory in You
verse_text: Victory comes from You, O Lord. May Your blessings rest on Your People.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 4:3 

You can be sure of this: The Lord set apart the godly for himself. 

The Lord will answer when I call to him. 



Today's Thoughts:

The godly are those who are faithful and devoted to God. David knew that God
would hear him

when he called and would answer him-We too, can be confident that God
listens to our prayers

And answers when we call upon HimSometimes we think that God will not hear us because we have fallen short of
His high standards

for holy living. BUT if we have trusted Christ for salvation, God has
forgiven us, and He will listen

to us. .



When you feel that your prayers are bouncing off the ceiling, remember as a
believer you have

been set apart by God and that He loves you. He hears and answers--although
His answers may

not be what you expected-look at your problems in light of God's power
instead of looking at

God in the shadow of your problems. 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, in the midst of my problems strengthen my faith

so that I would never doubt that You hear or answer my prayers. Amen.





Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.
original_reflection_text: The godly are those who are faithful and devoted to God. David knew that God would hear him when he called and would answer him-We too, can be confident that God listens to our prayers And answers when we call upon HimSometimes we think that God will not hear us because we have fallen short of His high standards for holy living. BUT if we have trusted Christ for salvation, God has forgiven us, and He will listen to us. When you feel that your prayers are bouncing off the ceiling, remember as a believer you have been set apart by God and that He loves you. He hears and answers--although His answers may not be what you expected-look at your problems in light of God's power instead of looking at God in the shadow of your problems.
original_verse_text: You can be sure of this: The Lord set apart the godly for himself. The Lord will answer when I call to him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You as Your faithful and devoted children, trusting that You hear our prayers and answer when we call upon You. Though we may fall short of Your holy standards, we are grateful that through Christ, You have forgiven us and set us apart as Yours. Help us to look to Your power, rather than the shadows of our problems, and to have confidence that You are attentive to our needs. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The godly are those who are faithful and devoted to God. David knew that God would hear him when he called and would answer him-We too, can be confident that God listens to our prayers And answers when we call upon HimSometimes we think that God will not hear us because we have fallen short of His high standards for holy living. BUT if we have trusted Christ for salvation, God has forgiven us, and He will listen to us. When you feel that your prayers are bouncing off the ceiling, remember as a believer you have been set apart by God and that He loves you. He hears and answers--although His answers may not be what you expected-look at your problems in light of God's power instead of looking at God in the shadow of your problems.
subject: God Hears and Answers Prayers
verse_text: You can be sure of this: The Lord set apart the godly for himself. The Lord will answer when I call to him.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 4:5-6 (NLT)

Offer sacrifices in the right spirit, and trust the Lord. 
6 Many people say, "Who will show us better times?" 

Let your face smile on us, Lord. 



Today's Thoughts:

As we know worship in David's day included animal sacrifices by the priests
in the Tabernacle.

The animal's blood covered the sins of the one who offered the animals.
There were specific 

rules for offering sacrifices, but more important to God than ceremony was
the attitude or

submission and obedience-as we see in (I Sam. 15:22, 23). .



Today a "proper sacrifice," one that is pleasing to God, is still the same,
He wants our obedience

and our praise before our gifts as seen in-(Heb. 13:15). .



SO let us remember to offer God our sacrifice of total obedience and
heartfelt praise. 



Today's Prayer suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's
guidance

so that I would be submissive to Your will and that my praises would be
pleasing

To You, I pray this in the name of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. .
Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2
original_reflection_text: As we know worship in David's day included animal sacrifices by the priests in the Tabernacle. The animal's blood covered the sins of the one who offered the animals. There were specific rules for offering sacrifices, but more important to God than ceremony was the attitude or submission and obedience-as we see in (I Samuel 15:22, 23). Today a "proper sacrifice, " one that is pleasing to God, is still the same, He wants our obedience and our praise before our gifts as seen in-(Hebrews 13:15). SO let us remember to offer God our sacrifice of total obedience and heartfelt praise. .
original_verse_text: Offer sacrifices in the right spirit, and trust the Lord. 6 Many people say, "Who will show us better times?" Let your face smile on us, Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts filled with gratitude and a desire to honor You. Help us to offer the sacrifice of obedience and praise that is pleasing in Your sight, not merely outward ceremony, but a sincere submission to Your will. May our lives be a living sacrifice, a testament to Your goodness and grace. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: As we know worship in David's day included animal sacrifices by the priests in the Tabernacle. The animal's blood covered the sins of the one who offered the animals. There were specific rules for offering sacrifices, but more important to God than ceremony was the attitude or submission and obedience-as we see in (I Samuel 15:22, 23). Today a “proper sacrifice, ” one that is pleasing to God, is still the same, He wants our obedience and our praise before our gifts as seen in-(Hebrews 13:15). SO let us remember to offer God our sacrifice of total obedience and heartfelt praise. .
subject: Obedience and Praise Pleasing to God
verse_text: Offer sacrifices in the right spirit, and trust the Lord. 6 Many people say, “Who will show us better times?” Let your face smile on us, Lord.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 4:7-8 (NLT)

7 You have given me greater joy than those who have abundant harvests of
grain and new wine

8 In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, O Lord, will keep me
safe. 



Today's Thoughts:

Two kinds of joy are contrasted here-inward joy that come from knowing and
trusting Godand happiness that comes as a result of pleasant circumstances. .



Inward joy is steady as long as we trust God, happiness is unpredictable.
Inward joy defeats

discouragement; happiness covers it up-Inward joy is lasting; happiness is
temporary. .



The choice is yours-neither is forced upon us. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord my choice is simple I choose knowing and trusting You so that

I may have the inward lasting Joy that comes from You. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: Two kinds of joy are contrasted here-inward joy that come from knowing and trusting Godand happiness that comes as a result of pleasant circumstances. Inward joy is steady as long as we trust God, happiness is unpredictable. Inward joy defeats discouragement; happiness covers it up-Inward joy is lasting; happiness is temporary. The choice is yours-neither is forced upon us. .
original_verse_text: 7 You have given me greater joy than those who have abundant harvests of grain and new wine 8 In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, O Lord, will keep me safe.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, rejoicing in the inward joy that comes from knowing and trusting in You. As the world around us offers fleeting happiness, we cling to the steadfast peace that only You can provide. Help us to set our minds on the things above, to find contentment in Your presence, and to cast our anxieties upon You, that we may experience the fullness of Your joy. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Two kinds of joy are contrasted here-inward joy that come from knowing and trusting Godand happiness that comes as a result of pleasant circumstances. Inward joy is steady as long as we trust God, happiness is unpredictable. Inward joy defeats discouragement; happiness covers it up-Inward joy is lasting; happiness is temporary. The choice is yours-neither is forced upon us. .
subject: Steady Joy Amid Changing Circumstances
verse_text: 7 You have given me greater joy than those who have abundant harvests of grain and new wine 8 In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, O Lord, will keep me safe.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 5:5-8 (NLT)

5 Therefore, the proud may not stand in your presence, for you hate all who
do evil.

6 You will destroy those who tell lies. The Lord detests murderers and
deceivers. 
7 Because of your unfailing love, I can enter your house; I will worship at
your Temple with deepest awe.

8 Lead me in the right path, O Lord, or my enemies will conquer me. Make
your way plain for me to follow. 



Today's Thoughts:

God cannot condone or even excuse the smallest sin-SO we cannot excuse
ourselves for sinning only

A little bit-as we grow spiritually, our sensitivity to sin will also
increase. .



What is your reaction to sin in your life?

Are you insensitive-unconcerned-disappointed-or comfortable?



As God makes us aware of sin-we must be intolerant toward it and be willing
to change.

All believers should strive to be more tolerant of people-BUT-less tolerant
of the sins in 

others and themselves. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize my own sins as easily as I see
the sins of others.

Lead me in the right path-make Your way plain to me. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: God cannot condone or even excuse the smallest sin-SO we cannot excuse ourselves for sinning only A little bit-as we grow spiritually, our sensitivity to sin will also increase. What is your reaction to sin in your life? Are you insensitive-unconcerned-disappointed-or comfortable? As God makes us aware of sin-we must be intolerant toward it and be willing to change. All believers should strive to be more tolerant of people-BUT-less tolerant of the sins in others and themselves. .
original_verse_text: 5 Therefore, the proud may not stand in your presence, for you hate all who do evil. 6 You will destroy those who tell lies. The Lord detests murderers and deceivers. 7 Because of your unfailing love, I can enter your house; 1 will worship at your Temple with deepest awe. 8 Lead me in the right path, O Lord, or my enemies will conquer me. Make your way plain for me to follow.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the weight of our sin. As Your Word teaches, we cannot hide or excuse our transgressions, for You are a righteous God who cannot tolerate even the smallest of sins. Forgive us for the times we have been insensitive or comfortable with the sin in our lives. Grant us the wisdom to recognize our faults, the courage to confess them, and the strength to turn away from them. May our sensitivity to sin increase as we grow in our relationship with You. Cleanse us, Lord, and lead us in the way of righteousness. Amen.
reflection: God cannot condone or even excuse the smallest sin, so we cannot excuse ourselves for sinning only a little bit. As we grow spiritually, our sensitivity to sin will also increase. What is your reaction to sin in your life? Are you insensitive, unconcerned, disappointed, or comfortable? As God makes us aware of sin, we must be intolerant toward it and be willing to change. All believers should strive to be more tolerant of people, but less tolerant of the sins in others and themselves.
subject: Intolerant of Sin, Tolerant of People
verse_text: 5 Therefore, the proud may not stand in your presence, for you hate all who do evil. 6 You will destroy those who tell lies. The Lord detests murderers and deceivers. 7 Because of your unfailing love, I can enter your house; 1 will worship at your Temple with deepest awe. 8 Lead me in the right path, O Lord, or my enemies will conquer me. Make your way plain for me to follow.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 6:1-3 (NLT)

1 O Lord, don't rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your rage.

2 Have compassion on me, Lord, for I am weak. Heal me, Lord, for my bones
are in agony.

3 I am sick at heart. How long, O Lord, until you restore me? 



Today's Thoughts:

David accepted God's punishment-but he begged God not to discipline him in
anger.

Jeremiah also asked God to correct him gently and not in anger (Jer. 10:24).
. .



David recognized that if God treated him with justice alone and not with
mercy, he

would be wiped out by God's wrath.



Often we want God to show mercy to us and justice to everyone else.

BUT-God in His kindness forgives us instead of giving us what we deserve.



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, it is only by Your grace and mercy that I can come before You

seeking Your divine forgiveness. So I beg of You forgive my sins of thoughtword-and deed. Bless all my E-mail friends with safety and good health. .
Amen.



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather



I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.
original_reflection_text: David accepted God's punishment-but he begged God not to discipline him in anger. Jeremiah also asked God to correct him gently and not in anger (Jeremiah 10:24). David recognized that if God treated him with justice alone and not with mercy, he would be wiped out by God's wrath. Often we want God to show mercy to us and justice to everyone else. BUT-God in His kindness forgives us instead of giving us what we deserve.
original_verse_text: 1 O Lord, don't rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your rage. 2 Have compassion on me, Lord, for I am weak. Heal me, Lord, for my bones are in agony. 3 I am sick at heart. How long, O Lord, until you restore me?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing our need for Your gracious correction and discipline. Like David and Jeremiah, we ask that You would not rebuke us in Your anger, nor chastise us in Your wrath. Instead, Lord, correct us with Your gentle hand, that we may be refined and transformed by Your loving kindness. Help us to receive Your discipline with repentant spirits, knowing that Your mercies are new every morning. Amen.
reflection: David accepted God's punishment, but he begged God not to discipline him in anger. Jeremiah also asked God to correct him gently and not in anger (Jeremiah 10:24). David recognized that if God treated him with justice alone and not with mercy, he would be wiped out by God's wrath. Often we want God to show mercy to us and justice to everyone else. But God, in His kindness, forgives us instead of giving us what we deserve.
subject: Accepting God's Gentle Correction
verse_text: 1 O Lord, don't rebuke me in your anger or discipline me in your rage. 2 Have compassion on me, Lord, for I am weak. Heal me, Lord, for my bones are in agony. 3 I am sick at heart. How long, O Lord, until you restore me?

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 6:6-10 (NLT)

I am worn out from sobbing. All night I flood my bed with weeping,
drenching it with my tears.

7 My vision is blurred by grief; my eyes are worn out because of all my
enemies. 
8 Go away, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping.

9 The Lord has heard my plea; the Lord will answer my prayer.

10 May all my enemies be disgraced and terrified. May they suddenly turn
back in shame. 



Today's Thoughts:

Pouring out his heart with tears, David was completely honest with GodWe can be honest with God even when we are filled with anger or despair

because God knows us thoroughly and wants the very best for us.

Anger may result in rash outward acts or turning inward in depression.



BUT if we trust in our all-powerful God-we don't have to be victims of

circumstances or be weighed down by the guilt of sin. .



Be honest with God-and He will help you turn your attention from yourself

to Him and His mercy. 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me of my sins so that I may not be

weighed down with guilt. Help me see to turn my attention on

You and realize Your grace and mercy. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.
original_reflection_text: Pouring out his heart with tears, David was completely honest with GodWe can be honest with God even when we are filled with anger or despair because God knows us thoroughly and wants the very best for us. Anger may result in rash outward acts or turning inward in depression. BUT if we trust in our all-powerful God-we don't have to be victims of circumstances or be weighed down by the guilt of sin. Be honest with God-and He will help you turn your attention from yourself to Him and His mercy. .
original_verse_text: I am worn out from sobbing. All night I flood my bed with weeping, drenching it with my tears. 7 My vision is blurred by grief; my eyes are worn out because of all my enemies. 8 Go away, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping. 9 The Lord has heard my plea; the Lord will answer my prayer. 10 May all my enemies be disgraced and terrified. May they suddenly turn back in shame.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with honest hearts, pouring out our sorrows and frustrations. Like David, we are weighed down by the burdens of this world, yet we trust in Your unfailing love and power. Forgive us for the times we have turned inward in despair, and help us to fix our eyes on You, the source of all comfort and strength. In our distress, may we call upon Your name, knowing that You hear our cries and will deliver us. Amen.
reflection: Pouring out his heart with tears, David was completely honest with GodWe can be honest with God even when we are filled with anger or despair because God knows us thoroughly and wants the very best for us. Anger may result in rash outward acts or turning inward in depression. BUT if we trust in our all-powerful God-we don't have to be victims of circumstances or be weighed down by the guilt of sin. Be honest with God-and He will help you turn your attention from yourself to Him and His mercy. .
subject: Honest Tears Before God
verse_text: I am worn out from sobbing. All night I flood my bed with weeping, drenching it with my tears. 7 My vision is blurred by grief; my eyes are worn out because of all my enemies. 8 Go away, all you who do evil, for the Lord has heard my weeping. 9 The Lord has heard my plea; the Lord will answer my prayer. 10 May all my enemies be disgraced and terrified. May they suddenly turn back in shame.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 7:1-6 (NLT)

1 I come to you for protection, O Lord my God. Save me from my
persecutors-rescue me!

2 If You don't, they will maul me like a lion, tearing me to pieces with no
one to rescue me.

3 O Lord my God, if I have done wrong or am guilty of injustice,

4 If I have betrayed a friend or plundered my enemy without cause,

5 Then let my enemies capture me. Let them trample me into the ground and
drag my honor in the dust. 
6 Arise, O Lord, in anger! Stand up against the fury of my enemies! Wake up,
my God, and bring justice! 



Today's Thoughts:

Have you ever been falsely accused or so badly hurt that you wanted revenge?

David wrote this Psalm in response to the slanderous accusations of those
who

claimed he was trying to kill Saul and seize the throne (I Sam. 24:9-11). 



Instead of taking things into his own hands and striking back, David cried
out to

God for justice. The proper response to slander is prayer, not
revenge-because

God says: "I will take revenge-I will repay those who deserve it" (Ro.
12:19; Heb. 10:30)



Instead of striking back ask God to take your case-to bring justice-and
restore your reputation. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me bridle my tongue and instil in me pure thoughts

when something slanderous has been said about me. Help me to have

a Christ-like attitude. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather



"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7
original_reflection_text: Have you ever been falsely accused or so badly hurt that you wanted revenge? David wrote this Psalm in response to the slanderous accusations of those who claimed he was trying to kill Saul and seize the throne (I Samuel 24:9-11). Instead of taking things into his own hands and striking back, David cried out to God for justice. The proper response to slander is prayer, not revenge-because God says: "I will take revenge-I will repay those who deserve it" (Romans 12:19; Hebrews 10:30) Instead of striking back ask God to take your case-to bring justice-and restore your reputation. .
original_verse_text: 1 I come to you for protection, O Lord my God. Save me from my persecutors-rescue me! 2 If You don't, they will maul me like a lion, tearing me to pieces with no one to rescue me. 3 O Lord my God, if I have done wrong or am guilty of injustice, 4 If I have betrayed a friend or plundered my enemy without cause, 5 Then let my enemies capture me. Let them trample me into the ground and drag my honor in the dust. 6 Arise, O Lord, in anger! Stand up against the fury of my enemies! Wake up, my God, and bring justice!
prayer: Heavenly Father, I come to You in this time of trial, when I have been falsely accused and my name has been slandered. I resist the temptation to seek revenge, for You have said that vengeance belongs to You. Lord, I trust in Your perfect justice and righteousness. Vindicate me, O Lord my God, according to Your righteousness, and do not let my enemies rejoice over me. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever been falsely accused or so badly hurt that you wanted revenge? David wrote this Psalm in response to the slanderous accusations of those who claimed he was trying to kill Saul and seize the throne (I Samuel 24:9-11). Instead of taking things into his own hands and striking back, David cried out to God for justice. The proper response to slander is prayer, not revenge-because God says: “I will take revenge-I will repay those who deserve it” (Romans 12:19; Hebrews 10:30) Instead of striking back ask God to take your case-to bring justice-and restore your reputation. .
subject: Cry Out to God for Justice
verse_text: 1 I come to you for protection, O Lord my God. Save me from my persecutors-rescue me! 2 If You don't, they will maul me like a lion, tearing me to pieces with no one to rescue me. 3 O Lord my God, if I have done wrong or am guilty of injustice, 4 If I have betrayed a friend or plundered my enemy without cause, 5 Then let my enemies capture me. Let them trample me into the ground and drag my honor in the dust. 6 Arise, O Lord, in anger! Stand up against the fury of my enemies! Wake up, my God, and bring justice!

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 7:9 (NLT) 

End the evil of those who are wicked, and defend the righteous. 

For you look deep within the mind and heart, O righteous God. 



Today's Thoughts:

OH YES! God looks "deep within in the mind and heart." Nothing is hidden
from GodNow this can either be terrifying or comforting. Our thoughts are an open
book to God.



OH YES! Let us also remember that He also knows our motives-we have no
place to hideNo way we can pretend to get away with sin-BUT that knowledge can also give
us comfort.

We don't have to impress God or put up a false front.



Instead-we can trust God to help us work through our weaknesses in order to
serve Him

as He has planned-when we truly follow God, He rewards our efforts. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Thank You Lord, for Your Love and faithfulness. My request today is that You

Will help me avoid my weaknesses so that I may serve You according to Your
plan. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-_1
original_reflection_text: OH YES! God looks "deep within in the mind and heart. " Nothing is hidden from GodNow this can either be terrifying or comforting. Our thoughts are an open book to God. OH YES! Let us also remember that He also knows our motives-we have no place to hideNo way we can pretend to get away with sin-BUT that knowledge can also give us comfort. We don't have to impress God or put up a false front. Instead-we can trust God to help us work through our weaknesses in order to serve Him as He has planned-when we truly follow God, He rewards our efforts.
original_verse_text: End the evil of those who are wicked, and defend the righteous. For you look deep within the mind and heart, O righteous God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts open, knowing that You see deep within us, discerning our thoughts and motives. We find comfort in the truth that nothing is hidden from Your sight, for You know us fully and love us still. Help us to trust in Your perfect judgment, that we may serve You with sincerity, working through our weaknesses by Your grace. May our lives be a reflection of Your will, as You reward our faithful efforts. Amen.
reflection: OH YES! God looks “deep within in the mind and heart. ” Nothing is hidden from GodNow this can either be terrifying or comforting. Our thoughts are an open book to God. OH YES! Let us also remember that He also knows our motives-we have no place to hideNo way we can pretend to get away with sin-BUT that knowledge can also give us comfort. We don't have to impress God or put up a false front. Instead-we can trust God to help us work through our weaknesses in order to serve Him as He has planned-when we truly follow God, He rewards our efforts.
subject: Knowing God Sees the Heart
verse_text: End the evil of those who are wicked, and defend the righteous. For you look deep within the mind and heart, O righteous God.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 7:17 (NLT)

I will thank the Lord because he is just; I will sing praise to the name of
the Lord Most High. 



Today's Thoughts

During times of great evil and injustice, David was grateful that God is
just and faithfulWhen we wonder if anyone is honest and fair, we can be assured that God will
continue

to bring justice and fairness when we involve Him in our activitiesIf you ever feel that you are being treat unfairly, ask the One who is
always fair and just

to be with you. Then thank Him for His presence. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You, that You are fair and just and that

You are a loving and forgiving God. I thank You for being close at hand

and are just a prayer away. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1
original_reflection_text: During times of great evil and injustice, David was grateful that God is just and faithfulWhen we wonder if anyone is honest and fair, we can be assured that God will continue to bring justice and fairness when we involve Him in our activitiesIf you ever feel that you are being treat unfairly, ask the One who is always fair and just to be with you. Then thank Him for His presence
original_verse_text: I will thank the Lord because he is just; I will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your unwavering justice and faithfulness. When the world seems unjust and unfair, we are grateful that You remain the righteous Judge, ever-present to bring fairness and equity. Lord, we ask that You would be with us in times of adversity, guiding us with Your wisdom and sustaining us with Your steadfast love. May our hearts overflow with thanksgiving for Your abiding presence and Your promise to uphold the cause of the righteous. Amen.
reflection: During times of great evil and injustice, David was grateful that God is just and faithful. When we wonder if anyone is honest and fair, we can be assured that God will continue to bring justice and fairness when we involve Him in our activities. If you ever feel that you are being treated unfairly, ask the One who is always fair and just to be with you. Then thank Him for His presence.
subject: Grateful for God's Justice and Faithfulness
verse_text: I will thank the Lord because he is just; I will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 7:14-16 (NLT)

14 The wicked conceive evil; they are pregnant with trouble and give birth
to lies.

15 They dig a deep pit to trap others, then fall into it themselves.

16 The trouble they make for others backfires on them. The violence they
plan falls on their own heads. 



Today's Thoughts:

When allowed to run its course, evil often destroys itself. Violent people
become

victims of violence and liars become victims of others' deceit. BUT in the
process

innocent people are hurtSometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks in order to
protect 

His followers-At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil


to continue even though innocent people are hurt. .



It is during these times that we must ask God to protect us-Remember God
will

execute final justice although it may not be during our lifetime. 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, we are living in sinful times, drugs and violence of every kind

are prevalent and our young people are in the midst of it all, protect Your

followers from this evil that plagues our country. Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2
original_reflection_text: When allowed to run its course, evil often destroys itself. Violent people become victims of violence and liars become victims of others' deceit. BUT in the process innocent people are hurtSometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks in order to protect His followers-At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must ask God to protect us-Remember God will execute final justice although it may not be during our lifetime. .
original_verse_text: 14 The wicked conceive evil; they are pregnant with trouble and give birth to lies. 15 They dig a deep pit to trap others, then fall into it themselves. 16 The trouble they make for others backfires on them. The violence they plan falls on their own heads.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the reality of evil in this world. We know that those who dig a pit will fall into it, and those who roll a stone will have it roll back on them. Yet, we also recognize that innocent lives are often caught in the crossfire. Lord, we ask that You would intervene and stop the plans of the wicked, protecting Your children from harm. When it is Your will to allow evil to continue, grant us the strength and wisdom to endure, trusting that You will execute final justice in Your perfect timing. We cling to Your promise of ultimate victory over all darkness. Amen.
reflection: When allowed to run its course, evil often destroys itself. Violent people become victims of violence, and liars become victims of others' deceit. But in the process, innocent people are hurt. Sometimes God intervenes and stops evildoers in their tracks in order to protect His followers. At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must ask God to protect us. Remember, God will execute final justice, although it may not be during our lifetime.
subject: Overcoming Evil Through Faith
verse_text: 14 The wicked conceive evil; they are pregnant with trouble and give birth to lies. 15 They dig a deep pit to trap others, then fall into it themselves. 16 The trouble they make for others backfires on them. The violence they plan falls on their own heads.

original_content:
Today's Verse's: Psalm 8:1-2 (NLT)

1 O Lord, our Lord, your majestic name fills the earth! Your glory is higher
than the heavens.

2 You have taught children and infants to tell of your strength, silencing
your enemies and all who oppose you. 



Today's Thoughts:

Have you noticed how easy it is for children to trust and praise God without
reservations?

Have you also notice that, as we grow older, many of us find it more and
more difficult to do so.



So what are we to do? Well what we need to do is ask God to give us a
childlike faith removing 

any and all barriers-so that we might have a closer walk with Him. .
Simple yes, 

but oh how often we neglect to do just that, if we did it would eliminate oh
so many worries.



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord remove the barriers that stand in the way that I might 

praise You as I should so that I might have a closer walk with You. .Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10
original_reflection_text: Have you noticed how easy it is for children to trust and praise God without reservations? Have you also notice that, as we grow older, many of us find it more and more difficult to do so. So what are we to do? Well what we need to do is ask God to give us a childlike faith removing any and all barriers-so that we might have a closer walk with Him. Simple yes, but oh how often we neglect to do just that, if we did it would eliminate oh so many worries.
original_verse_text: 1 O Lord, our Lord, your majestic name fills the earth! Your glory is higher than the heavens. 2 You have taught children and infants to tell of your strength, silencing your enemies and all who oppose you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts filled with gratitude for the gift of Your Word. Help us to cultivate a childlike faith, unencumbered by the complexities of this world. May we trust in You wholeheartedly, praising Your name with unwavering devotion, as the Psalmist did. Instill in us the wisdom and understanding found in Proverbs, that we may walk in Your ways and find favor in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: Have you noticed how easy it is for children to trust and praise God without reservations? Have you also noticed that, as we grow older, many of us find it more and more difficult to do so? So what are we to do? Well, what we need to do is ask God to give us a childlike faith, removing any and all barriers, so that we might have a closer walk with Him. Simple, yes, but oh, how often we neglect to do just that. If we did, it would eliminate oh so many worries.
subject: Cultivate Childlike Faith
verse_text: 1 O Lord, our Lord, your majestic name fills the earth! Your glory is higher than the heavens. 2 You have taught children and infants to tell of your strength, silencing your enemies and all who oppose you.

original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 8:3-5 (NLT)

When I look at the night sky and see the work of your fingers- the moon and
the stars you set in place4 what are people that you should think about them, mere mortals that you
should care for them? 

5 Yet you made them only a little lower than God and crowned them with glory
and honor. 



Today's Thoughts:

In order to respect God's Majesty, we must compare ourselves to His
greatness.

When we look at all creation, we often feel small by comparison. Now to feel
small 

Is a healthy way to get back to reality, but God does not want us to dwell
on our

smallness. .



Remember this, humility means proper respect for God, not self-depreciation.

The next time you question your worth as a person, remember that God

considers you highly valuable. We have great worth because we bear the 

stamp of the Creator.



Remember God considered us so valuable that He sacrificed His own Son

so that the debt for our sins was paid in full. 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, I often wonder how You can be concerned for me when I 

constantly disappoint you. This is a love that I cannot begin to phantom.

All I can do is thank You once again, and beg Your forgiveness. Amen.



Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Ps. 7:17 I will thank the Lord because He is just;

I will sing praises to the name of the Lord Most High.
original_reflection_text: In order to respect God's Majesty, we must compare ourselves to His greatness. When we look at all creation, we often feel small by comparison. Now to feel small Is a healthy way to get back to reality, but God does not want us to dwell on our smallness. Remember this, humility means proper respect for God, not self-depreciation. The next time you question your worth as a person, remember that God considers you highly valuable. We have great worth because we bear the stamp of the Creator. Remember God considered us so valuable that He sacrificed His own Son so that the debt for our sins was paid in full. .
original_verse_text: When I look at the night sky and see the work of your fingers - the moon and the stars you set in place4 what are people that you should think about them, mere mortals that you should care for them? 5 Yet you made them only a little lower than God and crowned them with glory and honor.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your majestic creation, marveling at the wonders of the heavens and the work of Your hands. Yet, in Your great love and mercy, You have deemed us, Your children, to be of immense worth, worthy of the sacrifice of Your own Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to walk in humility, with proper respect for Your glory, while also embracing the truth of our value in Your sight. May we live as those who have been made alive in Christ, to the praise of Your glorious grace. Amen.
reflection: In order to respect God's Majesty, we must compare ourselves to His greatness. When we look at all creation, we often feel small by comparison. Now to feel small Is a healthy way to get back to reality, but God does not want us to dwell on our smallness. Remember this, humility means proper respect for God, not self-depreciation. The next time you question your worth as a person, remember that God considers you highly valuable. We have great worth because we bear the stamp of the Creator. Remember God considered us so valuable that He sacrificed His own Son so that the debt for our sins was paid in full. .
subject: Embrace God's Majesty, Discover Your Worth
verse_text: When I look at the night sky and see the work of your fingers - the moon and the stars you set in place4 what are people that you should think about them, mere mortals that you should care for them? 5 Yet you made them only a little lower than God and crowned them with glory and honor.

original_content:
HERE IS FRIDAY'S DEVO. AS I WILL BE IN ST. CLOUD



Today's Verse: Psalm 8:6 (NLT)

6 You put us in charge of everything You made, giving us authority over all
things.



Today's Thoughts:

God gave us human tremendous authority, to be in charge of the whole earth.

But with great authority comes great responsibility. If we own a pet, we
have

the legal authority to do with it as we wish, but we also have a
responsibility 

to feed and care for it.

How have you treated God's creation? Remember we are to use our resources
wisely

because God holds us accountable as stewards. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, Help me remember my responsibilities today so that I may be a
good steward. .Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: God gave us human tremendous authority, to be in charge of the whole earth. But with great authority comes great responsibility. If we own a pet, we have the legal authority to do with it as we wish, but we also have a responsibility to feed and care for it. How have you treated God's creation? Remember we are to use our resources wisely because God holds us accountable as stewards. .
original_verse_text: 6 You put us in charge of everything You made, giving us authority over all things.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the great authority You have entrusted to us as stewards of Your creation. Help us to use our dominion over the earth with wisdom and care, recognizing that we are accountable to You for how we treat the world and all that is in it. Grant us the discernment to manage Your resources responsibly, and the humility to fulfill our role as faithful caretakers. May we honor You in the way we exercise our God-given dominion. Amen.
reflection: God gave us humans tremendous authority to be in charge of the whole earth. But with great authority comes great responsibility. If we own a pet, we have the legal authority to do with it as we wish, but we also have a responsibility to feed and care for it. How have you treated God's creation? Remember, we are to use our resources wisely because God holds us accountable as stewards.
subject: Stewards of God's Creation
verse_text: 6 You put us in charge of everything You made, giving us authority over all things.

original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 9:1-3 (NLT)

I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart; I will tell of all the marvelous
things you have done.

2 I will be filled with joy because of you. I will sing praises to your
name, O Most High. 
3 My enemies retreated; they staggered and died when you appeared. 

Today's Thoughts:

When we express our praises to God we are showing our appreciation and
understanding of His worth. .

It is saying thank You for each of the aspects of His divine nature. .

In doing so our inward attitude becomes an outward expression. .

When we praise God, we help ourselves by expanding our awareness of who He
is. .



To further this awareness, in each Psalm you read, look for an attribute or
characteristic 

of God for which you can thank Him for. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear heavenly Father there are many marvelous things of which I could give
you praise.

Today I would just like to praise and thank You for providing the way of
salvation 

through Your Son, or Lord Jesus Christ. Guide me in the path of
righteousness. .Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6
original_reflection_text: When we express our praises to God we are showing our appreciation and understanding of His worth. It is saying thank You for each of the aspects of His divine nature. In doing so our inward attitude becomes an outward expression. When we praise God, we help ourselves by expanding our awareness of who He is. To further this awareness, in each Psalm you read, look for an attribute or characteristic of God for which you can thank Him for. .
original_verse_text: I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart; 1 will tell of all the marvelous things you have done. 2 I will be filled with joy because of you. I will sing praises to your name, O Most High. 3 My enemies retreated; they staggered and died when you appeared.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, lifting our voices in praise and thanksgiving. As we reflect on Your boundless love, Your steadfast faithfulness, and Your everlasting mercy, we are in awe of Your divine nature. Help us to continually seek Your presence, entering Your gates with thanksgiving and Your courts with praise, for You are good, and Your love endures forever. May our lives be a testament to Your greatness, that all the earth may know You as the one true God. Amen.
reflection: When we express our praises to God, we are showing our appreciation and understanding of His worth. It is saying “thank you” for each of the aspects of His divine nature. In doing so, our inward attitude becomes an outward expression. When we praise God, we help ourselves by expanding our awareness of who He is. To further this awareness, in each psalm you read, look for an attribute or characteristic of God for which you can thank Him.
subject: Praise God's Worthy Attributes
verse_text: I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart; 1 will tell of all the marvelous things you have done. 2 I will be filled with joy because of you. I will sing praises to your name, O Most High. 3 My enemies retreated; they staggered and died when you appeared.
